benchmark_details.name: DOCBENCH
benchmark_details.overview: DOCBENCH aims to provide a standardized benchmark for evaluating LLM-based document reading systems under diverse real-world scenarios, where the systems take a document file paired with one or multiple related questions as input and generate textual responses as output.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: Establish a standardized benchmark for evaluating LLM-based document reading systems.

data.source: Data was collected from publicly accessible online resources, including arXiv, company annual reports, government publications, and news articles.
data.annotation: Questions generated by human annotators and synthetic question generation using models.

methodology.calculation: Scores are assigned using a binary system based on correctness assessed by both human annotators and GPT-4.
methodology.interpretation: Accuracy is calculated as the proportion of correct answers identified by the evaluators.
methodology.baseline_results: Human performance accuracy is 83.0% across domains.
methodology.validation: Evaluation involves human annotators and automated scoring using LLMs.
